msContents.summary: Bank statement of receipt of poll tax and distributed taxes (merismoi) for 1 year; it was issued by the government bank at Theadelphia; the names of the payers are in alphabetical order

msItemStruct.note: Written along the fibers; on the back there is P.Col. V 1 verso 2
The cols. were numbered on the top and some numbers are preserved
Numbers at the bottom of the cols. indicate the number of names in the col
The names are preserved up to the letter psi and about 5 cols. of names are missing
An alphabetical order by the first 2 letters of each name is followed
The roll was considered a single document, but it was so long that it must have been divided
The "merismoi" are for the tower guard, prison guard, river guard; guard tax and pig tax
Checking marks next to a name indicate that the poll tax was paid

9 cols. written by two different hands: one writes the names in a large and elegant bookhand and the other writes remarks over the numbers; col. 1 is mostly illegible and contains 8 names; col. 2: 34 lines; col. 3: 32 lines; col. 4: 32 lines; col. 5: 33 lines; col. 6: 35 lines; col. 7: 28 lines; col. 8: 28 lines; only the line beginnings of col. 9 are preserved

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in July 1923; no. 1,1 (Lot II) in Bell's inventory
